Line 1: Line 1:
{{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}}
{{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}}
'''Pan Africanist Youth Congress(PAYCO)''' is the youth wing of the [[Pan Africanist Congress]] (PAC) in [[South Africa]]. PAYCO was founded in 1981. It held its first congress in 1986. Formerly known as '''Azanian Youth Unity''' up to until 1997.
'''Pan Africanist Youth Congress(PAYCO)''' is the youth wing of the [[Pan Africanist Congress]] (PAC) in [[South Africa]]. PAYCO was founded in 1981. It held its first congress in 1986. Formerly known as '''Azanian Youth Unity''' up to until 1997.
â   â
[[Image:payco-flag.png|thumb|right|150px|[[Azanian National Youth Unity|PAYCO]]]]
 
Its achievements include the formation of [[National Council of Trade Unions]] (NACTU), formation of [[Pan Africanist Student Organistion]] (PASO) and [[Pan-Africanist Student Movement of Azania]] (PASMA). PAYCO organization was critical in recruiting soldiers for the [[Azanian People's Liberation Army]] (APLA) and for the PAC to reestablish itself as a major political party in [[Azania]].
Its achievements include the formation of [[National Council of Trade Unions]] (NACTU), formation of [[Pan Africanist Student Organistion]] (PASO) and [[Pan-Africanist Student Movement of Azania]] (PASMA). PAYCO organization was critical in recruiting soldiers for the [[Azanian People's Liberation Army]] (APLA) and for the PAC to reestablish itself as a major political party in [[Azania]].
